title: Villain Origin Story
subject: The "villain origin story" of email
author: Ben Settle
body:
A few years ago I talked with a marketer who sent an email about his "villain origin story."

Basically, how he went from good guy to bad guy.

And you know what?

It was one of his most profitable emails ever.

Here's the thing:

Villain origin stories are powerful.

Especially in email.

Because nobody relates to the hero who has it all figured out.

They relate to the guy who got screwed over, got mad, and decided to burn it all down.

That's the guy people want to follow.

That's the guy people buy from.

Most marketers don't get this.

They're too busy pretending to be the hero.

Meanwhile...

The "villains" are making all the money.

This is why my Email Players subscribers write emails that sell.

They embrace the villain.

They tell the uncomfortable truths.

They don't pretend to be something they're not.

And their customers love them for it.

More on that tomorrow.

Ben Settle

P.S. Want to know the #1 mistake "hero" marketers make that kills their sales?

I'll tell you tomorrow.

analysis.selling_technique: Subtle product mention, no direct ask

analysis.contrarian_angle: Being the villain is better than being the hero
